Package View

Class GraphicalSegment

java.lang.Object
View.GraphicalSegment
public class GraphicalSegment extends Object
GraphicalSegment is the class that displays graphically on the drawn map. A graphical segment is composed of:
  • A segment.
  • A point (coordinates of the position on screen of the beginning of the segment).
  • A point (coordinates of the position on screen of the end of segment).
  • An indication about if it is selected or not. If applicable, it shows the name of the road.
Graphical Segments are created to display the segment (road of a map).
It can be red when there is an interaction with the mouse (over).
Author:
H4122
See Also:
Segment, DrawnMap

  • Constructor Details

    • GraphicalSegment

      public GraphicalSegment​(Segment segment, Point coordinatesDeparture, Point coordinatesArrival, boolean selected)
      Class constructor. Creates a graphical segment with the segment, the coordinates departure, the coordinates arrival and selected in parameters.
      Parameters:
      segment - The segment associate to the graphical segment.
      coordinatesDeparture - It determines of the position on screen of the departure of the segment.
      coordinatesArrival - It determines the position on screen of the arrival of the segment.
      selected - It determines whether a mouse is over the segment or not.

    • draw

      public void draw​(Graphics g)
      Represents graphically the segment on a map. It is a line. When selected, it is red and the name of the road is displayed.
      Parameters:
      g - an object of the graphics class.

    • drawPath

      public void drawPath​(Graphics g)
      Sources : https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2027613/how-to-draw-a-directed-arrow-line-in-java When a segment is used on a tour, the segment is drawn differently to show the path.
      Parameters:
